Reference epoch: J2000.0    XY-plane: plane of the Earth's orbit at the reference epoch              Note: obliquity of 84381.448 arcseconds wrt ICRF equator (IAU76)    X-axis  : out along ascending node of instantaneous plane of the Earth's              orbit and the Earth's mean equator at the reference epoch    Z-axis  : perpendicular to the xy-plane in the directional (+ or -) sense              of Earth's north pole at the reference epoch.  Symbol meaning [1 au= 149597870.700 km, 1 day= 86400.0 s]:    JDTDB    Julian Day Number, Barycentric Dynamical Time      X      X-component of position vector (au)                                     Y      Y-component of position vector (au)                                     Z      Z-component of position vector (au)                                     VX     X-component of velocity vector (au/day)                                 VY     Y-component of velocity vector (au/day)                                 VZ     Z-component of velocity vector (au/day)                                 LT     One-way down-leg Newtonian light-time (day)                             RG     Range; distance from coordinate center (au)                             RR     Range-rate; radial velocity wrt coord. center (au/day)            Geometric states/elements have no aberrations applied. Computations by ...     Solar
